segment.source: This topic describes best practices for working with the thread pool.
segment.target: This topic describes best practices for working with the thread pool.

segment.source: Do's
segment.target: Do's

segment.source: Use the thread pool to do parallel work in your app.
segment.target: Use the thread pool to do parallel work in your app.

segment.source: Use work items to accomplish extended tasks without blocking the UI thread.
segment.target: Use work items to accomplish extended tasks without blocking the UI thread.

segment.source: Create work items that are short-lived and independent.
segment.target: Create work items that are short-lived and independent.

segment.source: Work items run asynchronously and they can be submitted to the pool in any order from the queue.
segment.target: Work items run asynchronously and they can be submitted to the pool in any order from the queue.

segment.source: Dispatch updates to the UI thread with the Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.
segment.target: Dispatch updates to the UI thread with the Windows.UI.Core.CoreDispatcher.

segment.source: Use ThreadPoolTimer.CreateTimer instead of the Sleep function.
segment.target: Use ThreadPoolTimer.CreateTimer instead of the Sleep function.

segment.source: Use the thread pool instead of creating your own thread management system.
segment.target: Use the thread pool instead of creating your own thread management system.

segment.source: The thread pool runs at the OS level with advanced capability and is optimized to dynamically scale according to device resources and activity within the process and across the system.
segment.target: The thread pool runs at the OS level with advanced capability and is optimized to dynamically scale according to device resources and activity within the process and across the system.

segment.source: In C++, ensure that work item delegates use the agile threading model (C++ delegates are agile by default).
segment.target: In C++, ensure that work item delegates use the agile threading model (C++ delegates are agile by default).

segment.source: Use pre-allocated work items when you can't tolerate a resource allocation failure at time of use.
segment.target: Use pre-allocated work items when you can't tolerate a resource allocation failure at time of use.

segment.source: Dont's
segment.target: Dont's

segment.source: Don't create periodic timers with a period value of 1 millisecond (including 0).
segment.target: Don't create periodic timers with a period value of 1 millisecond (including 0).

segment.source: This will cause the work item to behave as a single-shot timer.
segment.target: This will cause the work item to behave as a single-shot timer.

segment.source: Don't submit periodic work items that take longer to complete than the amount of time you specified in the period parameter.
segment.target: Don't submit periodic work items that take longer to complete than the amount of time you specified in the period parameter.

segment.source: Don't try to send UI updates (other than toasts and notifications) from a work item dispatched from a background task.
segment.target: Don't try to send UI updates (other than toasts and notifications) from a work item dispatched from a background task.

segment.source: Instead, use background task progress and completion handlers - for example, IBackgroundTaskInstance.Progress.
segment.target: Instead, use background task progress and completion handlers - for example, IBackgroundTaskInstance.Progress.

segment.source: When you use work-item handlers that use the async keyword, be aware that the thread pool work item may be set to the complete state before all of the code in the handler has executed.
segment.target: When you use work-item handlers that use the async keyword, be aware that the thread pool work item may be set to the complete state before all of the code in the handler has executed.

segment.source: Code following an await keyword within the handler may execute after the work item has been set to the complete state.
segment.target: Code following an await keyword within the handler may execute after the work item has been set to the complete state.

segment.source: Don't try to run a pre-allocated work item more than once without reinitializing it.
segment.target: Don't try to run a pre-allocated work item more than once without reinitializing it.
